page.title: 16A Gamekeeper, Tongue
page.content: 'Our local gamekeeper likes his job. Atthis time of year in the spring he looks for vermin such as foxes and hoody crows that would eat the lambs. In winter he feeds the deer so that they won't raid the crops of the farmers or the crofters. He does not do much heather burning because each patch needs burned only every ten years. Heather burning has to stop in the middle of April so that new growth can come through and so that birds that are nesting aren't harmed. There are trout and salmon in the river and he sometimes has to take people fishing or stalking deer. He sees a lot of buzzards and eagles, foxes and badgers, and occasionally a pine marten.'
